job_title: Admissions Advisor in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Collaborative environment, helpful supervisors, and excellent leadership.
cons: Could be paid more in terms of salary but is not bad.

job_title: Core Faculty in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Strong sense of community. Collegial environment. Supportive of students.
cons: Administration is in transition. Workload is heavy for pay received.

review_title: Great University but still a Non Profit
job_title: Enrollment Operations in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Close knit staff and great supervisors
cons: Hard to move up the ladder and get a raise

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: The benefits, community, respect, professional development, and values of Fielding are incomparable.
cons: I cannot think of any cons for Fielding Graduate University.

review_title: Talks the talk, but does not walk the walk
job_title: Middle Management in Santa Barbara, CA
pros:
Some employees are very devoted and competent.   
Some flexibility once at middle manager level.
Decent benefits in this economic climate.
Provides laptops and good technical support to most employees.
cons:
Long hours for very little pay, especially at the middle management level.  
A large number of mean, nasty, arrogant employees who have worked there forever who enjoy forcing out competent and new employees.
No accountability or logical processes.  People make end runs and lie all the time.
Dumb HR team.
Bad behavior is a lifestyle at many levels and not just tolerated but often supported.
Certain teams are very, very dysfunctional.
Managers who shouldn't be managers as they have poor people skills and no prior management experience.  
Wimpy leaders who are scared of conflict.
One building is overcrowded (where the work gets done) and one is underutilized (where upper management is based) and one is hardly ever used (only one person has an office there).
In flux due to new President with the worst of corporate values increasing and the best of non-profit values decreasing.

job_title: Records Specialist in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Health insurance benefit is pretty good. The HMO provider in the area, Sansum, has been good for me. You can accrue up to 200 vacation hours as any given time, amounts to about 5 weeks paid time off. Administrative offices are in Santa Barbara, CA which is a beautiful place to work and live. Overall I have felt appreciated at work my leadership. Day to day tasks to contribute to helping students achieve advanced degrees. Organizational Values are worth wild.
cons: Santa Barbara is an expensive place to live and so it can be challenging as Fielding offers good, but not great salaries. Organization is relatively small. There are not many opportunities for advancement. Enrollments are down in Graduate Education industry wide, Fielding is feeling the crunch as well. Solid leadership is in place and I believe that to organization will survive, if not thrive, but this is not a place to work if the goal is to make lots of money.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I'm surprised to see some of these negative reviews. From my perspective, Fielding cares a lot about employees, it's mission-driven, and helps people advance in their career. Good health benefits and a nice amount of paid time off, including a week off during the holidays.
cons: It's a private non-profit so you're not going to get rich, and some areas are pretty busy.

review_title: A place that once was great...slowly sinking
pros: Good people who believe in the mission, vision, values. Decent location in SB near restaurants and freeway exit. 37.5 hour workweek (in theory).
cons:
Continual cuts in benefits. Vacation used to be 4 weeks. Now it's 2 weeks for new employees. 20% cuts in retirement contribution for all employees. Consistent cuts in medical plan. This on top of very low pay, a consistent increasing workload and very poor management. The hemorrhaging of good and dedicated staff doesn't seem a big impact on management. 
Glass ceiling is very low. No real vertical mobility unless you have a friend in the inside group.

review_title: Fielding is going through a difficult transition.
pros:
Decent pay and good benefits. 37.5 hour workweek for full-time. They 
 Would like to be an excellent place to work.
cons: Leadership lacks energy and motivation to implement necessary actions to make Fielding a great place to work.  Many staff have been around for too long.  There is a lack of creativity within the staff, and no programs to encourage learning, reaching, and exceeding.

review_title: Great Company- Feel's like working with Family
